title: Add --dockerfile option to modal_sandbox.py create commands
description:
Update modal_sandbox.py to support building images from Dockerfiles.

Add a --dockerfile option to the create commands (create default, create rust) that:
1. Takes a relative path to a Dockerfile  
2. Uses modal.Image.from_dockerfile() to build the image instead of the hardcoded image definition
3. Falls back to existing behavior when --dockerfile is not provided

The Dockerfile path should be resolved relative to the current working directory.

title: Expand dockerfile_path placeholder in create_command
description:
The create_command is run without expanding the {dockerfile_path} placeholder, causing a FileNotFoundError when trying to use the dockerfile_path feature.

In src/provider/default.rs, the create_sandbox method runs self.config.create_command directly without substituting {dockerfile_path}.

Fix: Before running the create_command, replace {dockerfile_path} with the actual value from self.config.dockerfile_path (or empty string if None).

Location: src/provider/default.rs, create_sandbox method around line 147

title: Restructure modal_sandbox.py: separate dockerfile command from existing commands
description:
Currently --dockerfile is a flag on 'create default' and 'create rust'. This makes the build slow when dockerfile is used.

Restructure so that:
1. 'create dockerfile <path>' - new command that builds from a Dockerfile. Must validate the file exists and print sensible error if not.
2. 'create default', 'create rust', etc. - keep using their hardcoded modal.Image definitions (fast path)

This allows users to choose:
- Fast: use the built-in image definitions (coupled but fast)
- Flexible: use a Dockerfile (slow but decoupled)

Changes needed:
1. Remove --dockerfile option from create_default and create_rust
2. Add new 'create dockerfile' subcommand that takes a path argument
3. Update the TOML configs to use 'create dockerfile .devcontainer/Dockerfile' instead of 'create default --dockerfile {dockerfile_path}'

title: Resolve duplicate thiserror dependency versions
description:
The codebase has duplicate versions of thiserror (v1.0.69 and v2.0.18).

Details:
- offload directly depends on thiserror v1.0.69
- bollard (docker client) transitively pulls in thiserror v2.0.18
- This creates unnecessary binary bloat

Resolution options:
1. Update bollard dependency to a version that uses thiserror v1.x (if available)
2. Update offload to use thiserror v2.x to match bollard
3. Document as acceptable if no easy resolution exists

Impact: Low priority - builds work fine, but increases binary size slightly.
